attributes.action: establish a policy of constructivism rather than competition in parliamentary debates
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: There is no place for rudeness in a parliamentary democracy. The petitioner is calling on the P.M. to encourage MP's to keep to discussion topics as part of new debating rules measures - possibly even introducing timed interspersions (in our house, we use an egg timer !), so they actually do the job they are paid for - represent their constituents and vote on issues of local, national and international concern. Not only can spectators hardly hear, anyway, but it just makes grown up , professional people look silly. What about introducing IT voting technology (details of an NRDC report forwarded to web team) - it is poverty, disease, illiteracy and injustice that are the "fights" - please encourage parliamentarians to view these issues more problem - solvingly - from two sides of the political spectrum rather than make enemies of each other.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
